So Jamie wrote to me today and said BACK UP YOU LJ cause they might kill it......
so now i'm all sad.  Man there are a lot of memories in this old journal, even coversations with my long lost friend squidhead which will never ever be replaced, not by all the gold and jewles in the world.  I'm happy it's now all safely saved onto my hard drive....but now i'm wishing I had been writing all this time, over the past few years.  So many things have happened, so many things have changed and now i'm an old fart with a failing memory (ok, well not really).

So new years resolution number 34502409243098236-0  if LJ stays online, i will update more often.

And to all my dear old friends.  I miss you and love you.
If ever any of you want to contact me if LJ dies
tess_lacoil@hotmail.com

or face book

andrea fryett

I've had the most lovely month ever i think. So many nice things have happened. To start with i performed in a show at mc gill university...a huge oriental dance event thrown by Elise Oasis where i danced with Ilhan Karabacak(Istanbul) -Ahmet Luleci and The Collage dance ensemble (Boston) - Tarik Sultan (NYC)-Dominique Favreau (MTL) -Elise(MTL) -Hannan Sultan (Toronto. Anyway I was blown away by how nice all the performers were and i managed to make a very unexpected friend. Ilhan, who is residing in montreal a the moment has been giving classes and is interested in working with me...if he stays in the city. He's so kind and helping me correct so many details in my dancing. He's a great character as well, silly and serious all rolled into one The other lovely thing is that we were both mentioned in the montreal gazette! http://mail.google.com/mail/?ui=1&view=page&name=js&ver=xtfw6uz0xzqv

A super hot super sexy bellydancer (me) needs a place to stay in ottawa for the weekend of the 21st of july...only saturday night i believe. I will be in a workshop all day and will be performing at night.

Tribal fusion Bellydance Courses Montreal Quebec

Tribal fusion Bellydance Courses

 

Introduction I:  Six week session starting Mon Sept 3rd at 6:30pm

$72


This Course is an introduction to the basics of Tribal fusion.  We will focus on posture, isolations, strengthening, stretching, group improvisation, Tribal fusion combinations, tribal costuming, and history. Geared toward the new dancer this class establishes a strong foundation for continued study or just pure curiosity.  At the end of the course well will put our new moves into choreography.  Handouts available.

 

Introduction II:  Six week session begins Mon Oct 15th at 6:30

$72

This class is a continuation of studies from Introduction I, and builds on skills learned in the first level. Emphasis for this class is on growing and developing our dance at a more thoughtful and detailed level. We will focus on challenging drills to bring awareness to our muscle groups while developing more precise isolations, pop locks and layering, mixing both sharp staccato movements with slow snake like movements.  As in Introduction I we will use our new moves to create and refine choreography.

 

Courses located  at

 

La Compagnie Medievale

7250 rue Clark

2em etage

514-983-9910

 

For both sessions the cost is $130

 

Practices available each Friday evening for 5 dollars with members of Ethereal Tribal.

 

What to wear:  Comfortable pants typically worn to yoga or the gym, and a shirt that allows you to view movement.  Hip scarves of any kind are not necessary but help you to view you own movements.  Dance shoes are recommended.

I made a little troupe with lovely girls who i adore. we're calling ourselves Ethereal Tribal because every time i dance people tell me it is (other worldly, or they were transported to another world, and one woman even said my dancing is very ethereal.) I also thought it was appropriate because the dance it's self is taken from dozens of other cultures but then mixed with our own perceptions of them since we do not experience them for ourselves, making it almost a make believe version of a historical dance. Anyway this was our first show together. ps. sorry they're blurry...we were moving lots and the camera's couldn't use flashes.

just checking to make sure the ffp is next weekend....
cause i need to ask for the weekend off of work and organize the troops, etc

AND last but most definitely not least a link to a stunning stunning stunning video that phreedhum did with my dancing in it. She is such a genius....make sure your speakers are up as well, she also did the sound and i LOVE it. http://subtlemovements.com/videomusic/yellow_flowers_intro.html

http://www.ecollegey.com/organic.html

For anyone interested in organic fruits, veggies, meats, dairy, grains, etc, this place delivers and has a huge order list.  You don't just get a basket without any control over what goes in it, you actually get to place an order, and they deliver twice a week.

All the stuff you see outside in the map are done by me...except the plants, they were donated by ubisoft, but i placed them all exactly as you see them. Also inside the cave, my friend alex and i did together, we both took turns modeling and texturing it, and then lit the thing together. Also last night was the year end party for school and i got to do a little four song bellydance show....ther were about 250 people there....i wasn't nervous at all and it was a whole lot of fun Also i have a job officially, i was told a couple days ago. They said they'll start me off on ninja turtles but i think they have it in mind to move me to concept art as soon as i can prove i'm fast enough at drawing...which means i will practice like crazy all next week. Possibly things could change though in the near future, ubisoft likes to change it's mind five or six times a day....so well see.

I had a dream about tony last night.  We were all at the pharm, it was just getting dark, and i was wandering around with a glow stick.  At some point i looked down and realized that i had the glowstick goo all over my foot.  Being a hypochondriac i started to freak out and found tony siting on a log.  I sat with him and told him my dilemma and asked if i needed to go to the hospital.  Tony just smiled at me and said "andrea, you're so silly, you'll be fine", and as he always did changed the subject to get my mind off of it, and we were just hanging out.  The whole thing was just so real,  my problem, the way he reacted, we went through those kinds of things all the time.  And he was just so vivid, i could see very detail, small imperfections in his skin, the hair on his legs between the bottom of his shorts and the tops of his socks, his posture.  Everything else in my dream was exaggerated, except for him, except for this moment.

I woke up crying....
haven't really been able to stop all day.
i feel like we made a new memory.

Ok so i'm moving out...
I'm looking for a 3/12 or 4/12 for around 500...a little more if it's all included...
prefereably around rosemont, beaubien, jean talon, jarry metro's.....
if someone know's of anything or hears of something good...i would love it if they let me know.

Thanks all

When i was young i encountered the world of myst, a magical place of fantastic landscapes, dramatic lighting and breath taking atmosphere.  I thought to myself "i wish one day i could make something this beautiful".  Of course i figured only the best of the best of the best get to work on projects like that, thought i might have an easier time becoming a movie star or astronaut, so quickly gave up on that little dream.

Well today the company that brought us that game http://www.ubi.com/ENCA/ gave me a letter containing an offer of employment.  Imagine that after seven years i will be working on projects that i never imagined possible.  After seven years i have reached and surpassed that dream and can move on to bigger ones.  When i had my interview it seemed that possible in the future i may find a job in the concept art dept....This is what i will work on, making a living doing nothing but drawing, and all the while, being considered a professional in my field.

I had a dream the other night that i walked onto a beautiful garden balcony. All of my friends were there and we were having a party in memory of tony, we could feel his presence there even though we could not see him. In the center of the garden was a beautiful marble sculpture of a life size girl. As i was admiring it a women who had the same face as the girl in the sculpture aproached me. She told me she was the girls sister and said she was going to bring her back to life. She reached forward and put her hands on both sides of the sculptures head, as she did the stone turned to skin and the girl slumpted forward, looked up, and smiled. I became so overwhelmed with emotion over the sculpture and especially over tony that i began to cry. Someone mentioned that the girl in the sculpture was a witch and was killed during the witch trials, but witches didn't die that way they said, because they returned to nature and were thus imortal. The sculpture put her hands on my back and began to draw all the pain out. I could feel it passing through me so strongly that it woke me up. When i woak i was sitting in bed crying. And today i've been polishing old 3d work for my demo.... I textured that first character that i did months ago and built a little room for her. The lighting and texturing is not really complete (it's still to dark and i need to adjust light colour), and dave will help me animate her doing a little fan dance this weekend.....But it give you an idea. Also she's open for critique.

so looks like i'm taking to bus to hawkesbury tomorrow....
problem is that i really can't afford it.
before my surgery i was making $60 a week but had to take four weeks off....then we got stuck with a $550 hydro bill.....

if anyone knows of a car other than olivia's and jesse's which is heading out in that direction i'd really appreciate knowing....I think i'm the last person without a ride.

ok i found a few more Tony was super into taking photo's for a while when he had an expensive camera on loan and took some really really nice photo's of jason and i. This being my favorite. It was one of my favorite sunny spring days, spent in the park with two of my favorite people.

well this is what i managed to dig up from jason's old hard drive.... i know there used to be more.....i just cant find them That computer was doing some bizzare stuff though so it's possible some of my files got deleted...or vanished. I know there was a whole file in particular which had losts of pictures of jason and tony in blue and white...and the thing is gone. Plus i know he was with us when they plastered me for my lilith project...and in all of the pictures that were taken at that event...i can't find a single one with tony in it. AND i'm sure that some of this or all of this is repeat from others collections :( but just in case here they are bah I'll keep digging later.

I had my surgery last friday.  I had a nasty allergic reaction to some of the drugs and developed a rash and puked for hours and hours even though i had an empty stomach for over 12 hour before my surgery.  Guess what i was puking....bile and anesthetic.  Normally with this surgery they send you home the same day, however i was too weak and stoned and sick so they kept me over night.

The gas stuff that they filled my abdomen with was by far the worst part.  It was so painful for about two days that i had to sleep sitting up in a chair and could barely breath, even on two codeine pills.

The surgery it's self apparently went really smoothly, the cysts (i had two in the same ovary) came out very easily.  The teratoma (mutated genetic matter one was easy to take out) and the other water filled one i believe they just pop.  Apparently between the two cysts my ovary was about the size of a golf ball. 
No wonder the nasty thing hurt.

I'm getting better now though, i still get tired quickly and my ovary still hurts a bit, but it's not so bad.  The incisions themselves were never a problem.

Also a friend sent me this http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-2023320890224991194
Just when you thought you heard everything about 9/11
It's long though....just watch if yer either bored or super interested.
He's not rigged yet so the posture is fucking boring. sorry.

I'm serioulsy in love with ZBrush.  Photoshop and a wacom couldn't drag me away from drawing, but i have a funny feelin ZBrushand a wacom could.

I was sitting under a tree with some friends looking at a burnt old house.  Sitting on the front porch of the house was a young man wearing torn burned jeans, he was carving something with a pocket knife, and his left leg was leaning against the wall beside him with the foot up.  There were definitely strange things about him but he did not seem obviously dead to me.  He was much more fleshy and lucid than the other ghosts in my dreams.  My friends started to talk about him which pissed him off so he walked over and with a sweeping motion of his hand caused a force which made it impossible to breath for a few seconds.  My friends freaked out and ran but i was curious and begged him to stay to talk.  Finally he agreed by asking me if i knew how to dig and pointed to a spoon and a hole in the drive way.  He revealed that he and his girlfriend had been in the house when it burned, she had been trapped under a part of falling ceiling when they tried to get out, so the only part of her he could save was her head.  Which he buried in the driveway and which i was expected to dig up.  I was really nervous of the ghost at first but he was actually very nice, when he noticed i was afraid of him he threw a little snowball at me in a playful manner and then laughed.  He didn't say very much but i could tell he was lonely.  

I went back to digging up the head, finally got it out of the ground, wrapped it in some cloth and went to give it to him but i woke up.

ZBrush is this weird 3d program where you can model things kind of like clay by using a mouse or even better yet, a wacom. So what i did was to build the low poly version of the head in 3DSMAX, then imported it into ZBrush and went from there. After you use this high poly ZBrush version to build something called a normal map which you apply to your low poly character. Basically it makes it appear and react (to light for example) as if your character is super high poly...even though it's not. It's kind of like cheating :P

I spend yesterday making up a new choreography to teach to my students and practiced it over and over so i don't look like a fool when i try to teach it to them. Luckily all this exercise is ridding me of my soft warm christmas fat. When i was exhausted and kind of bored i made this self indulgent, narcissistic photoshop thing. I think deep down we're all huge camera whores.

Christmas was lovely. Dave and i made the long journey to ontario to spend time with my mommy and daddy. It was a full house this year, lindsey and john were there, john's mom and dad also came for christmas dinner, and my nanny and poppa came from fort erie to visit for christmas as well. I guess the family is expanding.....weird. After christmas dave and i spent a couple of days at home and did some more painting. The last tennants had this thing for colours and colour combinations that would make most people barf. Floyd said they were probably colour blind circus clowns, i suspect he might be right. Then we went to quebec for new years to see daves family. Time with his family is always quiet and nice, especially at his moms place. His dad's side of the family like to joke around and shout like crazy old french people, which isn't surprising because that is what they are (and i mean that in the most loving way possible). Before we left for quebec dave realized that he did not have a gift for his family, so we cheaped out and gave them a picture of us. I thought this was a kind of narcissistic idea but it seemed to go over fairly well. For your amusement this is the photo we gave them, laugh if you will :P For new years we didn't have any plans so we ended up at this little bar called le temps partiel (my french spelling is worse than my english). It was a very small crowd and a rather strange mix of really friendly people and really desperate people. There was this kind of old chubby lady dressed in something that wasn't very flattering who kept dancing around. She obviously wanted to get laid but her three male companions were obviously gay, so no luck there. She was trying to pick up EVERYONE in the bar. She would go up to men and just sort of turn around in this weird 3 1/4 angle view for them and kept looking at them and then her ass, trying to advertise it. Man that was amusing. Some of daves old friends work there as bar maids so they got us drunk for free all night. Then i made out with one of daves ex's. Cutest girl ever but reminded me a lot of myself at her age. Dave and i then proceeded to try to discuss all our relationship problems to see if we could come up with a way of fixing them. I think we may have found a way that might work. I hope so, aside from the problems that we have we are very well suited for each other, and i'm pretty sure with a little effort we can get over this. also i'm only writing all this boring crap because i should be doing homework...so time to sign off me thinks.

I just calculated my budget.  If i don't factor in paying hydro or buying groceries i have a total of $16.48 i can spend daily until i'm finished school in May.

Lovely.

ps
i'm too old for this shit.
Here's some more work i did in 3d

Today we met the guy who did the matte paintings for Sin city  http://www.jessyv.com/ .  He gave a demo on how to do matte paintings etc.  I showed him some of my paintings and my sorry attempt at a matte painting and he was kind of impressed with my work, so i get to do stuff and send it to him for critique.

Very Very nice guy too.

Also i found out my lighting and rendering prof is a bit of a "star" as well  http://raphael.lacoste.free.fr/ check out the rendering sections (if you're not already on the page from clicking the link).

This is retarded i know.  But you have to admit it's fun to see HOW MUCH STUFF you can put on you cat while he's sleeping.

Jamie, you're going to love this

http://www.stuffonmycat.com/

So here is the news
For our final project at campus ubisoft we have the option to make a splinter cell game. We will form two teams and work on it.  This will be a fully functional game as we have modelers animators and programmers studying here.  They are doing this as an attempt to get us past an otherwise long and difficult adjustment period when we enter the work force.
This does not mean we HAVE to choose this option or we HAVE to work for ubi....but considering they told us today that basically anyone who wants a job there who study`s here will have one.  This is a HUGE relief and does a lot for my sense of motivation.  Not only do i know that all this WILL pay off in the end but i was basically already offered a job and will not have to hunt for one afterwards.

YAY for everyone in my school.

We also have an invite to the ubisoft christmas pary...woo woo woo...their christmas partys are legendary in montreal...for anyone who doensn`t live here

I just got through my first private dance show.  Christ that was tiring.  I was bad and did it all improv because i didn't have time to choreograph a freeking thing before hand.  BUT, they were very impressed with my performance none the less.  The family is from egypt and one of the members said he just came back from there and i was better than any of the dancers he saw while he was there.  They seemed pretty surprised that i've only been dancing since like 2001. 

I'll try to post pictures later, if any of them are flattering.  Dance pictures, especially belly dance pictures are almost always horrible.  The movements are all so beautiful until you stop them and take them out of context.  But i'll see how they turn out.

These people were crazy too.  Both the wife and husband were engineers and the daughter and her husband were lawyers.  They had heated toilet seats i kid you not.  I should have charged more......
they were nice though and gave us tea and desert after.  They all wanted to ask question about dancing and stuff and i needed the time to rest so we stuck around.  Apparently years ago they had a dancer who didn't dance very much at all and instead tried to get everyone else to dance.  She went so far as to put a veil over some guys head.  Man that kind of invasion of personal space is not cool.


Anyway
I'm tired so off to bed for me.
I have nothing else to say now

http://www.holylemon.com/CrazyDancing.html

Check out the geek in the orange shirt and white pants.....
All i can say about this is....

THAT'S NOT FAIR!

If anyone is free to give me a little ride from my old apartment to my new apartment with some of my stuff (namely my fish aquarium and turtle aquariums) as well as a few boxes on thursday or friday at any time i will LOVE you FOREVER and buy you a dinner, lunch, or something of the like in return.  There will also be a lovely invite to our house warming party in a few weeks with booze included.  

(oh except i teach a dance class friday at 7:30 so it can't be then)

This is a one time only limited offer so sound really enthusiastic asap or you will really regret missing out on this fabulous opportunity.

I taught my dance class today and everyone looked fucking bored.  
they were all complaining last time that i went TOOO FAST.  So i slowed it down and repeated several moves over and over hoping they would get it.


But they looked BORED.  one girl started looking out the open window, some girl with an attitude left early with her friends, and evertime i shimmied a girl in the front would make a discusted "i can't do that, you can't expect me to do that" face.  

I HOPE it's better tomorrow
